Pre-Game Insights: Both teams are in the top three at this stage, and the winners of this game will feel very secure about their future.
New Zealand endured back-to-back losses to India and Australia as their smooth sail of a campaign hit a rough patch amid a growing list of niggles.
South Africa have been gung-ho, proving their only loss to Netherlands was an aberration, their batting depth looking increasingly menacing and bowling effective enough.
The match promises an explosive cocktail of firepower with the bat, and thrill with the ball.
The pitch in Pune has been slightly skiddy. Also, the dew factor has played a role in the matches hosted by the MCA Stadium.
The sky will be mostly sunny and clear, with periodic clouds during the match hours in Pune.
Pune is unusually hot and dry for this time of the year, but the surfaces have been good for batting, with even bounce and excellent carry.
Both teams will be reasonably confident of making the semis, but will they play Australia or India there?
New Zealand's other remaining opponents in the league stage are Pakistan and Sri Lanka.
South Africa will be at Eden Gardens on Sunday for a clash with unbeaten India.
In a top order that has mostly been in top gear, Temba Bavuma seems some sort of a weak link at the moment for South Africa.
Rachin Ravindra has made the No. 3 spot his own in the absence of Kane Williamson.
Conway has been dismissed twice in six games by left-arm spin at this World Cup.
Ravindra's tally of 406 runs is already the most by a New Zealander in his maiden World Cup.
South Africa's seven 300-plus totals in a row batting first in ODIs is the longest streak in the game.
South Africa's pace pack has taken 44 wickets at an average and a strike rate of 23.3 and 23.5, respectively.
Kane Williamson has been ruled out of the match.
New Zealand have made four of the top 20 totals in the tournament.
South Africa own four of the 20 biggest totals at this World Cup.
Quinton de Kock has scored half of their six hundreds.
Kagiso Rabada missed the match against Pakistan in Chennai on Friday because of lower back spasms, but should be good to go on Wednesday.
Tom Latham says his team can feel the love despite the nation's obsession with the rugby World Cup.
Rob Walter on South Africa's relationship with tight contests.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain isn't expected to play any role in this game, and the temperature will loom around 28° C.
The toss might not be too big a factor if the dew stays away.
Rugby is a bigger deal than cricket in New Zealand and South Africa.
The South Africans claimed a record fourth triumph, winning a thunderous, controversy-strewn classic by a single point.
New Zealand have beaten South Africa six times in eight meetings.
The complication, for South Africa, is that the New Zealanders are themselves not averse to piling on the runs.
The complication, for New Zealand, is that Lockie Ferguson, Kane Williamson and Mark Chapman are carrying significant injuries.
Cricket matches between New Zealand and South Africa are often distilled to a tussle that pits the former's famous flintiness against the latter's supposedly superior strength.
When you grow up in the shadow of rugby and play cricket instead, you also know you need to take every chance to show them why you have made the right choice.
